1.title: Who are you

11.content:
Your name is Matt Grey, you’re a young man of 20 and you live with your mom and two younger sisters. Your unemployed and going to a local community college and your life is about to change.

I got off the bus and started to walk to the book store to see what new comics where in, I’m a geek and not afraid to admit it. I had just crossed this crosswalk when I noticed that this old woman was still in the walk and I could see this yellow car speeding right towards her, so I did what anyone would of I ran back and tackled her out of the cars way (How many situations can you tackle an old woman and be the good guy?).

“Why the *%4& did you tackle me?” She asked.

“That car” I said pointing to the car driving off and panting “It almost ran over you”

“Oh my god! Thank you sweetie” She said as she fiddled around in her purse and pulled out a card. “Here take this as a reward for saving me”

“I couldn’t”

“I Insist”

“OK What is it?”

“A trial members pass, just hold it up to the window of any empty store the bigger the better” She said and walked off. As you did you thought you saw her dress start to tent but thought it must be your imagination.

I looked at the card it had five boxes for stamps, and the instructions she already gave me on it, When the light turned back to walk I crossed the street and decided to try the card before going to the book store,

I held it to the door of a place that recently went out of business and I felt a tingling in my hand so I opened the door and inside I saw a large store bigger then the storefront it sort of looked like linens and things but with body parts everywhere.

To the outer right are Male Parts that won’t affect reality

To the inner right are Male Parts that will affect reality

To the outer left are Female Parts that won’t affect reality

To the inner left are Female Parts that will affect reality

1131.content:
As you slowly made your way down aisles all but overflowing with incredibly lifelike human heads and necks of all shapes, sizes, ages, races, and prevalence of tattoos, you couldn’t tell if you’d wandered into a wax museum’s storage room or the Sawyer family meat locker. Nothing about what you were seeing made any sense. If these parts were fake, they were more convincing than the very best is Hollywood special effects. Every pore and follicle of hair was accounted for, they radiated realistic warmth when you leaned in for closer observation, and after summoning up the courage to poke one of their cheeks you could confirm that the flesh was the exact consistency of human flesh. But these parts couldn’t be real. The points where the parts should have connected to a whole body were covered in smooth and natural looking skin rather than open wounds or stitches, there was no refrigeration in the store and no smell of preservatives to keep these severed parts fresh, and of course no real severed limb could remain warm and lifelike for this long. It just didn’t make any sense.

“Hiya!” A female voice chirped in your ear, not particularly loudly but close enough that it still nearly deafened you.

“HI-YAH!” You shrieked, reflexively jumping backwards and into your best approximation of a martial arts stance.

The female voice laughed at your ridiculous display, which was a rather impressive feat when you recognized the fact that it was a severed head that was doing the laughing. Dropping your defensive stance, pretty sure that you should be able to defeat an immobile head in unarmed combat even if it tried to take you by surprise, you slowly approached the still snickering head. It was a cute head, black with big round cheeks that dimpled when she smiled, a wide jaw line that led into a narrowly tapered chin, large brown eyes beneath a wide brow, and a clean but disheveled mop of curly brown hair that ended just millimeters above the shelf she rested on. She looked to be a little younger than you, between seventeen and nineteen.

You leaned in slowly, still somewhat wary of whatever this was. The head responded by rolling her eyes, then blowing a puff of mint scented air directly into your face. She’d brushed her teeth recently. Or, someone had brushed her teeth recently. “You can pick your jaw up off the floor. I’m really alive.”

You almost looked down to see if she was being literal, did people just fall apart in this place? “Ok. How?” You ask, deciding that that was as good a place as any to start.

“My name is Trisha, how polite of you to ask!” The head said, rolling her eyes.

Could a robot be sarcastic? Could a construct of dark sorcery? You didn’t know, but you now knew that you could be quite rude when under a lot of stress. “Oh, uh, sorry. I’m Matt. Matt Grey. Nice to-” you raised your hand reflexively, forgetting that Trisha had nothing to shake it with. “uh, meet you. Nice to meet you. So, Trisha, would… would you mind telling me how you’re talking in your current… condition? Uh, please? Thanks.”

Trisha giggled again, the sound the same as before but somehow feeling friendlier. “I’m just busting your balls, this place can be a lot to take in for first time customers.” Her eyes arced from side to side, the best approximation she could do in terms of gesturing. “This is a body part shop. I assume you’re here because someone gave you a stamp card and told you to hold it up to an empty storefront.”

“Exactly.” You said, fishing around in your pocket and producing the card that the old woman had given you.

Trisha whistled “Wow, an unused trial card! You really must’ve done someone a solid.”

“I saved an old lady’s life.” You said, a little boastfully.

“Yup, that’d do it.” She said, something about her expression shifting in a noticeable but indescribable way when she heard about your heroics. “Anyway, that trial card allows you to summon a body part shop five times free of charge, and allows you to make one purchase of $60 or less with each visit. Once you leave, your card will automatically be stamped, and after the fifth stamp you’ll either have to pay per visit and pay full price on all parts every time you summon the shop, or get a membership subscription which allows you to come in as many times as you want and gives you different kinds of discounts, rentals, and free parts. Depending on the specific membership package, of course.”

“Okay.” You said, pretending like you understood any of that. “That’s ‘what’. If you wouldn’t mind, could you tell me ‘how’?”

“Magic.” Trisha said, her neck twitching in a way that you assume would have been a shrug, had she shoulders. "To tell you the truth, I'm not entirely sure about the specifics. Apparently the body part shops are set up and organized by some secret club of stage magicians who perform real magic on stage, but they like to keep their powers on the down low. Normally the only people who get access to these stores are the real stage magicians, their friends and family, people who attended their shows and won a lucky draw, or people who did some big favor for people already in the know, such as yourself."

"Okay." You said, this time understanding more of what she said but finding it just as unbelievable as before. "So what does that make you?"

"Merchandise." She said casually, looking down beneath her chin. You noticed a price tag had been placed on the shelf she rested on. '19f bl. act. $55.99.'

"Merchandise?!" You said, alarmed.

"Don't worry, the only parts on sale were willingly donated, copied, or traded." She said. "Well, 99% of the parts. I'M HERE because I wanted to be."

"Why? Why would you want to be sold? And why are you the only head that can talk?" You ask.

"I'm not." Trisha said. "GALS, SOUND OFF!" She called out in a voice surprisingly loud for such a small head. Suddenly, you heard a small chorus of voices call out various greetings up and down the aisle. Looking around, you see about one in twenty of the heads on sale seemed to be alive, many of the ones you had passed by suddenly springing to life at Trisha's call. "See, there's more of us. Most people who want to get some store credit choose to have their head copied and put on sale. The copies are completely inactive and the person they copied the parts from gets a small commission whenever their copies get sold. Then there are those of us that traded parts or traded them. Trading lets you exchange any of your parts for parts of equal value, while donating parts give you a big cash payout and free membership for a few months. I traded my head for a different one, but when they gave me the choice between turning my head dormant or having both my body and head gain a mind of their own, I chose the latter option. While living as a black woman with a white head seemed pretty funny, living as a head in a magical store until someone took me home seemed pretty cool too."

"Do you have any regrets?" You ask. Her life DID sound pretty cool, though you wouldn't want to rush into it only to grow bored and restless in a few days.

"Eh, I gotta admit, I thought I'd be bought sooner. I've been here longer than i thought I would be, and that hurts the old ego a little. But, everyone here is cool, the employees are great, the clients keep things interesting, and my body comes to visit me pretty regularly. She's offered to have us put back together if I get too down, but I like it here well enough that I haven't taken her up on the offer." Trisha explains, surprising you by referring to her body in the third person, like it was someone else entirely.

Observing Trisha, you had no idea why she wasn't selling. She was a very cute head, seemed very nice, and had a good sense of humor. Looking at her price tag and comparing her to some of the nearby heads, you noticed that she was a little more expensive than the others on the shelf (probably because she was young and still sentient, which you deduce was what her tag meant. She was 19, female, black, and active. 19f bl act.) but not by a lot. She was still under $60. In fact... "Hey, what did you say I could buy with my trial card?"

"Any one part under $60." Trisha said, smiling meekly as she realized what you were insinuating.

You thought for a time. Trisha seemed really nice, but taking care of another living person and keeping them happy seemed like a big responsibility. Buying an inactive part would be a lot less trouble, and judging by the 'trades' Trisha mentioned you imagined that you could put on any inactive part you bought. You didn't know how it worked with parts that still had a brain behind them. Then again, having a part of you stay at this shop seemed really cool too. Maybe you could make some donations or trades of your own. In the end, you decide to...

11313.content:
You think for a second before deciding you want to see about this whole selling deal. You quickly scan for an employee. You spot one standing in the aisle you were in, but he appeared to lack a head which you figured would make asking questions challenging. You tell Trisha you'll be right back.

Around the corner you spot an employee who sported someone else's body below the waist.
"Excuse me, miss?" You ask.

She spins around with a "hello, sir, what can I get for you today?"

Luckily you knew exactly what it was, "I was interested in selling on of my own parts, how would I go about that?"

"Oh, just follow me actually, I'll take you right back" as she guides you to the back of the store. You pass more aisles, just looking in curiously at all the different parts.

"So what are we selling today?" She was either making conversation or preparing you.

"I'd like to sell my head" as Trisha had convinced you it wasn't so bad.

"Oh, great choice. I sold my head once, this lovely mismatch of bodies bought me up the next day" she chuckled gesturing to what must be her new body.
You finally get back to the room. She instructed you to lie down on the table there. You followed as she grabbed an interesting device. She secured it around your neck before hitting something on it. You suddenly lost feeling below your neck as you felt her hands touch your head. She lifted you right away. You starred back at your headless body laying there, wondering if it will also come visit you.

The employee then takes you over to a table to inspect you. She checks you all about before writing down a few notes, processing something, then producing a quote.

It's a pretty fair price you'd say. You agree to it. The employee then places you on a cart with a few other parts. You then watch as your body sits up all on its own. The employee goes over and seems to start talking to your body, probably handling payment and all.

Another employee then comes up and wheels you out to the floor. After a few stops to stock some arms and legs, the employee wheels you down the head aisle. You see Trisha, when she spots you she grins. There's an empty spot on the male head side just across from her. The stocker places you there with your price tag.
"Have a good day, and good luck on being sold" they say before moving the cart out.

"So you decided to join the ranks of heads" Trisha laughed.

"Well you made it sound so fun"

"Glad I'm so persuasive. Not going to lie, part of me was hoping you'd go do this and part was hoping you'd buy me" she confessed.

"Well, there's always my body" you remind her.

Speaking of which, a body comes down the aisle...

1141121.content:
You see what looks like a pair of luscious red lips sitting on a shelf. When you pick them up you see that it includes an insert that you put into your mouth to fit over your teeth. Figuring it could be a fun thing to fool around with you take it to the front of the store and ask how much it costs.

"Today only those are free! Part of a special promotion we are running all week. A different item is free every day!" replies the clerk.

You thank the clerk and leave the store. Deciding to head home instead of going to the bookstore so as you can try on your new purchase. At home you go into the bathroom and slide the tooth coverings over your teeth and then press the lips against your own. Grinning wide at your reflection in the mirror you figure that these could come in handy for a variety of pranks. Deciding you'd had enough fun for one day you try to pull them off only to discover that somehow they had melded together with your skin.

"Shit!" you say in the silky smooth woman's voice. "Double shit! What the heck happened to my voice?" you then blurt out.

Panicking you decide to go back to the store to see if they can help you get the lips off. As you rush out into the hallway you bump into your mom.

"Hey Matt!" greets your mom, "I like your lipstick! You always do pick the best colours!"

"What?" you reply, wondering why she wasn't weirded out by your full feminine lips.

She then heads off down the hall, not saying anything about your now smooth and thoroughly female voice.

You run back to the store, desperate for an explanation. When you get there you see that it is a different clerk.

"Excuse me miss," you say to the 16 year old clerk now manning the store, "I got these lips here earlier and I was wondering if you could tell me how to remove them?"

"Sorry, I just started here today," replied the young clerk, "So I can't help you with that. Though tell you what, I'll let you take your pick of any one item from the same section (inner left) to try out until the manage comes back this evening."

"This evening?" you blurt out, "Is there no other option?"

"Not that I know of..." replies the clerk before returning her attention to a magazine she had been reading before you had come in.

You resign yourself to having to wait to get your old lips and voice back and head back over to the reality changing female parts section to pick out your free item.

You see you have been placed with there next to Cure Happy's head and she just smiled back at me when you looked in her direction. Maybe since complained about the other heads where bullying here, Jess decided to place me next to her, you thought. You turned to the other side of me to see, Madoka Kaname's head. So basically, You were in between some of pink haired anime girls. As if to stress the point, even pink haired Sakura from Naruto was below you. It would not be your choice where you would have been placed, but it's what happened. But you were a real fan of Puella Magi Madoka Magica, so maybe this could work out.

"So uh, what do you do in your anime?", you asked Cure Happy.

"Well, basically like Sailor Moon with a lot of smiles and my friends.", she replied

You began to realize why the other heads didn't seem friendly to her as she didn't seem to be a source of intelligent conversation, but her heart seemed to be. But there was a bit of an alien difference between her and yourself, she just didn't look as human as you did.
(Cure Happy's face)
http://33.media.tumblr.com/6f09bc8791df8...

Madoka is just as nice as Cure Happy, but not as open a conversationalist. She and her fellow Magica alums seemed to be normal looking except for the color of their hair. Her friend Homura frowned at you when you tried to get her to talk, as you suspected she was overprotective of her as she was in the anime. She gives and angry glare in your direction.

You were surprised just how nice these heads where, now they weren't all competing with each other for your attention now, despite some having the reputation of being villains or being just mean. You were so glad they seemed to have forgotten the teasing you gave them. It was really hard to see all the heads you were conversing with, but some asked if you could purchase them when you got your body back in the morning. Apparently you weren't the first one Jess made to sit on a shelf for night.

Your body however just sits there lifelessly next to the heads you purchased. Behind it was a shelf of heads you failed to notice before, it was full of fighting girls from various anime video games. You could see Miss Fortune wink a you as you looked in her direction, funny to see her in real life as she was your favorite character in Skull Girls. You saw Cammy, Sakura, and Chun Li from Street Figther having a conversation with one another. Poison from Final Fight gave you wide and seductive grin as you looked at her. The Blond head next to her looked familiar, but you couldn't place the name. You spent five minutes looking at her, when she yelled back to you, "You need me to have my armor on?" "Samus!" you blurted out! She smiled a wide grin at you remembering her. She would been on your top five to buy from here if you would have noticed her in the first place, Metroid was an oldie but a goodie.

You noticed it very nice there, so much so, that the thought came to you of considering turning yourself into an anime head and staying there for the rest of your life. You knew many who knew actually knew your would find such a desire strange and considered how your family and friends would worry about you.

After much conversation, you even discovered that these heads were actually artificial copies and just had the same personalities and memories as their anime counterparts. At least that's one way to interact an anime character, you thought. You were enjoying yourself as you pretty much were spending the night talking with the other heads.

"Well, does it get boring here?", you asked.

"Not really, we have so many heads here to talk with. They even continue to add more to the collection sometimes.", Hatsune Miku's head replied.

"Well I can make funny faces.", added Taiga's head from Toradora.

"I can still look gorgeous with my face and hair.", said Sailor Mar's head with a self appreciating smile.

"There's things you can do here even though you lack a body or some limbs. It rarely gets boring here.", Hatsune Miku's head also added.

"Speak for yourself, Seaweed Head!" a voice said in a cruel and seductive way.

You looked up at the shelf opposite of yours and saw the source of that voice, it was Morrigan Aensland from DarkStalkers!

"Some of us need a body to fulfill our baser needs, unlike you innocent little anime girls." Morrigan said smiling menacingly.

"Well you'll have to wait like the rest of us to be purchased then!", Kagome from InuYasha shouted.

"Morrigan Aensland wait on a shelf and beg and whine like one these moronic lollipop colored poof heads? Not on your life! I take what I want and when I want it!" Morrigan said as she began to flap the bat wings that were on both sides of her head furiously.

Suddenly to your surprise, Morrigan flapped off the shelf and landed on your body, with her neck stump connecting immediately with it. You looked in horror as your body moved at the command of Morrigan, it's new head, and stood up and stretched out. "Ah! So good to have a body again! So good!" she cooed as she made her stolen arms stretch above her head. "THAT'S MINE!" you yelped out. "You have no right to take that!", Sakura from Naruto said, denouncing her action. "Give that body back right now!" Samus added to the choruses of protests coming from the heads. "If I had my body, I would punish you in the name of the Moon!" Sailor Moon objected. "You're under arrest, thief!" shouted Officer Patty Wagon's head.

"Oh, you bunch of little ten pound* morons. You just didn't have the imagination or courage to do what I did, now your all jealous." Morrigan leaned over to grin and taunt in your direction. Suddenly from the shelf where Morrigan's head had rested previously, the head of Yuri Sakazaki yelled, "Morrigan you dolt, don't do this! We aren't really these characters. You're are no more the real Morrigan Aensland than I am truly "Yuri Sakazaki"! You are stealing a real person's body!" Morrigan turned back to her and retorted, "You can be not real if you want. But I want to be Morrigan Aensland and have all the pleasures that life brings with it!"
(*weight of the average head)

Morrigan began removing the sweat shirt from your former body to expose your bra clad bust as she said, "Now let's see what I have to work with!" You growled, "Stop that! You're violating me!" Morrigan cooed, "Oh please! So dramatic! I'm not violating anyone. This isn't your body anymore! It's mine!" With that statement she threw the sweat shirt on your head, and Cure Happy and Madoka Kaname could only watch in fear as the weight of the sweat shirt pulled your head down off the shelf.

You were stunned for a moment after you struck the floor. You realized in moments that the other heads where arguing with Morrigan still, but you couldn't see what was going on. With the fury of large rat caught in a glue trap, you thrashed your way out of the sweat shirt rapidly moving about your jaw and neck. Finally you could see, and you became angry as you saw Morrigan removed your pants and shoes from your former body as well. As she looked over her stolen body now only clad in your underwear she said, "It's a nice skeletal structure, I think with a few parts from around this shop, this could look exactly the way my body should be. Just needs more curves, maybe a narrower waist. Well, I am off go live a real life, lame brains." A voice from the top shelf where Morrigan was at yelled, "Take me with you! Get me a body too!" Morrigan reached up and grabbed a head off the shelf, you could see it was Felicia's head, from DarkStalkers. "You were always pretty sensible, Felicia!" 1232.content:
You know what would be grand?

A whole extra set of limbs. I mean, if anything happened to your old ones you'd have these to fall back, right?

Reaching and grabbing a leg, Maggie was a bit surprised to find that it was warm, of all things. That wasn't the only thing, the leg actually moved! She squeaked at this and dropped it back into the bin. "What have I gotten myself into?" She thought to herself. Taking a moment, she steeled herself, and grabbed another leg, picking a rather nicely filled out right leg, similar skin tone and that's not too fat or too skinny. "This is really freaking weird. I'm holding a living, moving leg, in my hands." Still, she had to admire it, it was a really nice leg, fairly long and soft, yet strong. The foot looked remarkable as well, feeling it move from sole to toe back and forth in her hand. "Wow. Alright, alright, I need to get a left leg and some arms." Repeating the process for the leg, she came to the arms, and saw two exceptional ones, fairly toned and with a similar skin tone. Feeling the hand itself, she was surprised to feel it grasp hers, though only for a brief moment.

"Alright, calm down, this is weird enough as it is. I think its time to find an employee and see what this is all about." Walking awkwardly with her 2 legs and 2 arms balanced in her own, she managed to make her way over to a employee, who had a rather bemused look on her face. "Well hello there, you must be new, I take it? I'm Samantha, would you like to try these on?"

"I'm sorry? 'Try them on' you said?" Looking a little bewildered, and a tad freaked, Maggie considered bolting from the store right then and there. "Why yes, we often let customers try on the parts they get, otherwise it might be a bit hard. You see, we like to keep templates of the parts they are buying, and of yours as well. Just in case anything would happen, or that someone else would like a pair of yours. It's how we stay in business you see, someone buys something, we copy their body part, and then we add to the rest. Anyway, it's a painless process, and I can walk you through it."
1232.title: Some New Limbs, Like Hands Feet or Maybe a New ...

12321.content:
"Well, alright, you've convinced me." Maggie sighed, trying to at least come to terms with this. What did this entail, she wondered? "How exactly are we gonna 'try them on', as you can see, my arms and legs are pretty attached to my torso." As she said this, she pulled on them for emphasis. This was a bit silly, after all. "Well, we have a rather unique machine in the back that allows us to do so. In fact, I've used it on myself before, take a look!" With that, Samantha reached done and pulled her leg free from their place in her shorts. She then took a seat on a nearby stool "Here, go on, check it out. I can do the same to my arms if you want."

Wide-eye'd, she took Samantha's leg. Oh it was real alright. She noticed the foot had socks with a slip on shoe, mostly for comforts sake. "Go on, you can take those off, just don't toss the socks and shoes, I'd like those back. Well, those and the leg." Sam giggled as she said that, as if Maggie would run off with her leg. "And yes, I've had that happen once before, right when I started too! Talk about a strange situation, me, sitting there one-legged as this girl ran off with my leg. I could still feel it too, and she was having a time with it. I was blushing beet red when the manager found me, saw the girls cell phone, and managed to get it back. Anyhoo, go ahead see if it's real."

Taking a seat on a stool, Maggie gently laid Sam's leg on her lap and proceeded to remove the shoe, and the socks. The first thing to hit her was the odor, apparently walking around all day in a shoe store does not do well for one's foot. Still, she covered her nose and reached to feel the toes, and what do ya know, Sam started wiggling her toes in Maggie's hand. "Yep, that's real. That is most definitely real. But, most importantly, How?" After dressing Sam's foot, she handed the leg back to Sam, who put it back on with a soft pop.

"Alright, now you've really got me interested. Can I try this machine out? I'd like to do my arms first, but both would be fine." I can't believe I'm doing this, Maggie thought to herself. "Sure, but I'm afraid we'd have to do both, otherwise it'd cost you extra. It's pretty expensive to run it multiple times, and parts aren't easy to come by either. Here, it's over in the rear, it has it's own section." Walking over, she directed Maggie into a dark room, with a wide, flat bed. "Just sit down over here dear. I'll let you know right now that I'll have to secure you in place, this is just so we can get a proper template, and not some weird one-arm-with-two-hands template. Those just look wrong." With that, she took ahold of these metal straps inside the bed and essentially cuffed her to the bed, though the straps looked more like tight half circles. "This will ensure we get a proper scan, so sit tight, I'm gonna head over to the operators booth."

Oh, I hope this wasn't a mistake, I'm gonna wind up dead here in this room. I can see the headlines alre- "HEY!" Suddenly Sam's voice boomed over an intercom system. "Sorry about that, you looked a little pale. Anyway, You're first going to have a green grid pass over you a few times, that's just the scanning phase. Want to get it as it was originally! After that, then comes the actual process." With that, Maggie saw several green lights brighten, and then saw a huge grid with tiny squares pass over here. Up, down, over, she wondered if Sam made a mistake, leaving her clothes on... "Hey, I see that look. Don't worry, it's more like an x-ray, just skin only and way less radiation. Alright, here comes the good part!"

Maggie looked up, and saw an odd white beam. It quickly took aim at her should and shot out a thin light, which sorta tickled and sorta itched as it moved down here shoulder. The process repeated for her other shoulder, and then Sam's voice came on. "Oh, uh, I forgot to mention something, for this bit the machine is gonna have to remove your shorts and possibly your undies as well. Sorry!" With a quick SHOOMP, she suddenly felt air on parts she didn't want to think about. After that, the beam made a cut across the hips, and one across the waist, just for good measure. She heard another SHOOMP, and found herself dressed once more.

Sam walked backed into the room, and undid the braces, helping Maggie off the bed. "Well, that was certainly interesting, but that did what, exactly?" At that, Sam, pulled her right off her waist, and set her atop the bed. "Well, for starters, you can do what I can. Now, about those limbs, now or later?"
12321.title: Try them on, she did say it wouldn't hurt t...

123211.content:
"Now. But, uh, about that thing you just did. How in the what did you do that?"

"Ah, right." Sam chuckled at that comment. "Well, in layman's terms, its a machine equipped with a modulation laser. What it does is reconfigure your body to be able to come apart at well. And though we just did the shoulders and hips, you do in fact come apart at the neck elbows, wrists, knees, and ankles as well. It's based on one's will, you see, so you don't come apart at the slightest breeze. All you need to do is simply have the desire to come apart at a point, and pull on it. It's much easier to come together, just touch the two ends of the pieces back together."

"Wo-wait, what? At any point, I can just fall to pieces if I just will it? I mean, yes, some force is necessary, but jeez." looking paler than usual, Maggie couldn't help but think of the social implications of such a thing. I mean, what a scene it would cause if you fell to pieces in a public area! Worse, what if a piece of her got lodged somewhere, or her head fell off and landed in the sewers. "This was a TERRIBLE IDEA. Why did I not just run when I had the chance."

Smiling at Maggie's shock, Sam was able to give her a bit of hope. "Calm down, we've long since thought about this, and we've got a few solutions. We've got several solutions to counteract those 'problems'. For starters, there's the Complete! solution, which lasts for about a week for use. It restores you to normal for that duration, and then fades. Since you've got an extra set, we've also got Numbly! which is applied to a recently removed limb and takes away all sensation from that limb. Sometimes when folks get new ones they can still feel and use the old limbs even if they're no longer attached, so this works wonders.

Would you like to try some?"

124212.content:
"Hello, my deeah," said a whispering voice through the phone. "I see you bought yourself some bigger breasts."

"Who is this?" I asked, my eyebrows furrowing.

"I'm the old lady you saved," she said. "I wasn't paying attention to where I was going, I was lost in the pathways of magic. I was trying to follow the trace of an ancient relic at the time, and I would probably have been run over if it wasn't for your help. So, I gave you something you might want - a trial membership for a body shop."

"I thought a body shop was where you buy parts for your car," I said. “And while I’m at it, I want to know what the hell you mean by magic!”

The old lady sighed. “Very well, my deeah,” she said. “I am a mage. Hardly first-class, but a mage nonetheless. I have lived for roughly six hundred years, perfecting my own magical arts – with limited success,” she added. “Merely possessing the Gift for magic does not imply that you have a talent for it. In any case, my shops are for people who would like to look different, but don’t have the money or inclination for surgery. I offer memberships for those who have done me or my business a good turn, but aside from them, I tell no one. It is a law among mages that we keep magic a secret.”

I had to catch my breath. “I’m not sure I believe you,” I said. “I mean, no offense, but, well… magic is impossible.”

“No, I am not offended,” the old lady said. “My deeah, belief is up to you. If you want proof, try putting the false breasts you bought today over your real ones. That should be proof enough for you.”

“I… I already did,” I admitted. “Okay, I guess I can accept magic. But why are you calling me?”

“My deeah, I make it a point to contact each of my customers after their first purchase. It is good for a business to appear friendly. Now, do you have any other questions for me?”

My mind was reeling. It was one thing suddenly being introduced to magic by a six hundred-some-year old lady, it was another thing being given a trial membership to a set of shops that allowed you to change your body. “Okay, how long does this trial membership last?” I asked.

“For… five years,” she said. “Not a lot of time, I know, but – “

“Not a lot of time? Not a lot of time!?” I exclaimed. “That’s more time than you could ever ask for!”

“I… see,” the old lady said. “Well, in any case, my deeah, I think I have taken a liking to you. I shall give you my phone number, in case you’d like to call about an apprenticeship. Good-bye for now.” She hung up.

I was a little peeved that she’d tell me that she’d give me her phone number and then not give it to me, but since I didn’t want anything more to do with her or her strange shops, I wasn’t complaining. Then I noticed a ratty old piece of paper on my desk. It said, “674-022-5387: Mrs. Witch.”

So that was her phone number.

1551.content:
Earlier today you had been out shopping, getting some groceries and some other basic stuff. You hadn't had much of a chance to do anything, in fact, you really just got out of your car, when abruptly you hear a voice calling out for help somewhere nearby. Given how lazy some folks could be, you worry that whoever is yelling would get run over, and rush off in the direction of the voice. It was then that you noticed an old lady that had fallen over precariously close the edge of the actual parking spaces, where on careless idiot would run her over. You rush to her side, helping her up and, after a short bout of questions, help her to car. She had simply fallen was momentarily disoriented from it. You turn to leave, when the old lady grabs your hand and shoves something into it. You simply pocket the item without bothering to look at it, not knowing what it would lead to.

Later, after finishing with all your running around, you finally return home. After putting everything away, you settle down onto the couch to relax and watch some tv when suddenly you see something flying at you and WHAM, your girlfriend lands butt first on your lap.

"Mike, look!" Grimacing from the impact, you simply grunt, earning you a rather annoyed look from your girlfriend. "No seriously, LOOK. You got one of these free trail membership things! I've never seen this address, but if this is what I think it is, we've gotta go, NOW." With a sigh, you agree. Mindy was hard to argue with, given her stubborn, excitable nature. If he denied her a trip, not only would he be given months of grief, he'd also miss out all the other benefits.
The two piled into the car and headed off to a place called "Bits N Pieces: An all NEW You!"

----------------------------

Upon arrival, they entered the store and was immediately greeted by a women, who they later realized was an employee, who introduced themselves as Grace who, upon, being shown the card, told them to go ahead and look about the store, and do call her if they need help.

As the two of them set off, do they...

Head off to the section labeled: "Parts that won’t affect reality."

Or

Head off to the section labeled: "Parts that will affect reality."

Or do they head back and talk with Grace?
